sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King a proclamation for the better encouragement, and aduancement of the trade of the East-Indie Companie, and for preuention of excesse of priuate trade. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
[3] leaves.
By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie: and by the Assignes of Iohn Bill, Imprinted at London : M.DC.XXXI [1631, i.e. 1632]
Caption title. Imprint from colophon. Arms, containing lion and unicorn, and initials "C R" at top. "Giuen at the Court at Whithall, the nineteenth day of February, in the seuenth yeere of the Reigne of Souereigne Lord King Charles of England, Scotland, France and Jreland, Defender of the Faith, &c." Reproduction of original in: Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
By the King a proclamation for the better encouragement, and aduancement of the trade of the East-Indie Companie, and for preuention of excesse of priuate trade. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
[3] leaves.
By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie: and by the Assignes of Iohn Bill, Imprinted at London : M.DC.XXXI [1631, i.e. 1632]
Caption title. Imprint from colophon. Arms, containing lion and unicorn, and initials "C R" at top. "Giuen at the Court at Whithall, the nineteenth day of February, in the seuenth yeere of the Reigne of Souereigne Lord King Charles of England, Scotland, France and Jreland, Defender of the Faith, &c." Reproduction of original in: Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

Robert Barker
